loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a single mother of 8 children, and four of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family (grandchildren). She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 8 years, selling to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through selling used clothes. She works at the market six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Astaluzi

texts.en: Astaluzi is a fifty-year-old widow with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. For ten years she has been raising animals and also earning a monthly salary as a civil servant. Diseases and limited land for grazing affect her business plan, while her dreams are to educate her children up to the University level and to own a ranch. Astaluzi intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Riziki's Group

texts.en:
Riziki is a thirty-two-year-old single mother of five children. She works on other people's farms for income and is paid by relief-service non-governmental organizations to dig for water. Her job working on farms is seasonal and sometimes she misses the opportunity to work for the relief organizations due to a high supply of local labor. 

Riziki is "fed up with the impoverished life she is exposed to and hopes to benefit from the sale of trees to enable her to live a decent life." She is joining the KOMAZA micro-forestry program so that she can educate her children, build a house and start other businesses with the profits from her tree farm.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Previously, Vusal was an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli town, but now he lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. He is married and has a child. Vusal needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy new pressure washers for cars. He wants to make innovations in his car washing business. He has been in this business for 3 years. He is 30 years old.

loans.use: To buy new pressure washers for cars.

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en:
Ghanem is a 37-year-old man. He’s married and lives in Lebanon with his wife and two children. He is the one responsible for covering his family expenses and responding to their needs. He also has his wife’s support. Ghanem is obliged to work continually as he tries to enhance his family’s way of living. 

He has been working in the construction field since 1997. Regardless of being satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial situation; that’s the reason why he’s asking today for a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to improve his business by purchasing new construction tools, as he plans to keep on offering the best quality of work for his clients. In the near future, he plans to take more loans to open his own construction tools shop. This is how he works really hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing new construction tools.

loans.name: Shumi

texts.en:
Shumi is fifty-seven years old, married to George and a mother of two children. She is a dressmaker and has been in this business for three years. She gets a monthly income of fifty-four thousand shillings.

This will be Shumi's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy an overlock sewing machine. In future she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To purchase an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Jumwa's Group

texts.en:
Jumwa is a forty-two-year-old mother of seven and businesswoman. To earn income for her family, she sells coconut wine, trades charcoal, bakes and sells 'mandazi' (a local doughnut), and works on other people's farms for payment. Her businesses face various challenges including customers defaulting on payments, lack of market for the wine, labor-intensive production of charcoal, and drought-limiting farming activity.

Jumwa is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that she can invest in her children's education with the profits from the tree farm. She also wants to build a house for her family with her proceeds.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, and training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is a thirty-three-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Twelve years ago he decided to set up a boutique in order to meet his increasing family expenses. Price fluctuation and high rental fees affect his business while his dreams are educating his children up to the university and owning a wholesale shop. Pascal intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Easter season when demand is very high.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a thirty-two-year-old single lady. She runs a hair salon in Luthuli in Nairobi city center. She has been in this business for five years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Jackline's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy tongs for making hairstyles and also buy beauty products. In future she wants to be a prosperous hairdresser.

loans.use: To buy tongs for making hairstyles and also buy beauty products

loans.name: Claudino

texts.pt:
Casado com um filho e residente de Massaca II
É professor de profissão e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento e blocos) e pagar mão-de-obra para a construção da sua residência.
O seu futuro subdivide-se em melhorar as suas condições habitacionais e a conclusão dos seus estudos.
Constitui o maior desafio a exiguidade financeira
texts.en:
Claudino is married with one son and lives in Massaca II.

He's a teacher by profession and with this loan he plans to buy construction material (cement and blocks) and pay for the labour for the building work on his home.

Claudino's future is divided between improving his living conditions and completing his studies.

His biggest challenge are financial liabilities.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement and blocks) and pay for the labour for the building work on his home.

loans.name: Albino

texts.pt:
Casado pai de dois filhos e reside em Manhanhane desde 1988
É empacotador de profissão e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento e ferro) para a conclusão da sua obra (construção da sala de estar)
No futuro pretende apetrechar a sua residência e comprar electrodomésticos logo que a sua zona estiver electrificada.
O maior desafio em encontrar um financiamento maior que lhe possa permitir realizar os seus projectos
texts.en:
Albino is married and the father of two children. He has lived in Manhanhane since 1988.

He's a packer by profession and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (cement and iron) to complete his building work (building a living room).

In future he plans to furnish his house and buy white goods as soon as there is electricity in his area.

His biggest challenge is to find more financing to allow him to make his projects a reality.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement and iron) to complete his building work (building a living room).

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a sixty-year-old tailor in Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and his wife earns additional income. Together they support six people in their family. He has been in the tailoring business for the last twenty years and has done great with good income.

This marks his third borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He will purchase textiles for his tailoring shop and will use the anticipated profit to pay his loan and expand the business. 

He hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase textiles for his tailoring shop.

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is a 39-year-old lady who is single with two children, ages 8 and 18. They both go to school. 

In 2007, Aminah started a business selling cereals. It has enabled her to take care of her family, and she has even put up some small rental units. Currently she requests a loan so she can purchase cereals in bulk from the village.

She buys her cereal from the village and sells it in the market, which is on the outskirts of Kampala city.

Aminah's greatest challenge is she does not own her own store in which to keep the cereals that she obtains from the countryside.

Her dream is to be able to open different branches of the business in other trading centers. Although Aminah is a single mother, she is determined to make the future bright for herself and her children.

It is only through borrowing funds that Aminah has come this far. So she would like to encourage those who lend money to people like her to continue since it truly makes a difference.

loans.use: To buy more cereals.

loans.name: Ezekiel's Group

texts.en: Ezekiel is a fifty-four year old farmer. He and his wife have ten children, five of which are still in school. Their work is very difficult due to erratic rainfall and lack of money to buy pesticides and medicines to protect their crops and animals. Ezekiel was attracted to the KOMAZA tree-planting program because he hoped his tree farm would improve the local environment, as well as generate income for his family.With the income he receives from his tree farm, Ezekiel hopes to educate his children, build a better house, and invest in quality-breed cattle.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Zawadi's Group

texts.en: Zawadi is a 34-year-old mother of five children. She works in a kiosk selling vegetables. The greatest challenge Zawadi faces is a lack of market to sell her produce. She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that "the entire family shall be able to live well and will be able to cater for their needs." Zawadi plans to use the proceeds from her tree farm to purchase a parcel of land and to educate her children. Her favorite part about the microforestry program is integrating with KOMAZA staff and working in a farmer group.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Casada mãe de 2 filhos e residente no bairro de chinonaquila em Boane
É negociante e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar diversos produtos (arroz, açucar,etc) para revenda.
Futuramente almeja construir dependências para arrendar e uma viatura que lhe facilite o transporte das mercadorias
O seu desafio é conseguir um empréstimo maior que possa cobrir com as despesas de construção.
texts.en:
Maria is married and a mother to two children. She lives in the Chinonaquila neighbourhood of Boane.

She is a saleswoman and with this loan she intends to buy several products (rice, sugar etc) for resale.

In the future she aspires to build rooms to rent and to buy a vehicle which would help her transport the merchandise.

Her challenge is to get a bigger loan which would cover her construction costs.

loans.use: to buy several products (rice, sugar etc) for resale

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a single mother of five children, four of whom go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.   

Sylvia has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for a few months. Previously, she sold vegetables. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She has applied for a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works from her home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  

Sylvia aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with five children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members such as her grandchildren.  

Mariam has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She sells to all categories of people but only on a retail basis.  She has no other income-generating activity. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works from home seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Mariam aspires to become a wholesaler and to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe/kmtn Group

texts.fr:
JEanne est membre du groupe  ABISHYIZEHAMWE KMTN, Elle est agé de 29 ans,,elle a 3 enfants dont le pls agé a 7 ans et le moins agé a 3 ans.elle a etudié jusq`au 6 eme primaire. elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les angrais chimiques,préparer son champs et acheter les médicament agricole.

les difficultés de non remboursement sont: l`innondation et la mort.ses stratégies pour la croissance de son activité est d`accroitre la production. ses ambitions pour son business est d`accroitre le projet de culture de tomate et pour sa famille c`est soinger sa famille.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a member of Abishyizehamwe KMTN Group. She's 29 years old and has three children. The eldest is seven years old, the youngest is three.

She attended elementary school for six years. She's seeking this loan to buy chemical fertilizers, prepare her field, and buy farming medicine.

Difficulties that may impair her ability to repay the loan are : flooding and death. Her strategy to grow her business is to increase production.

She ambitions to develop her tomato farming project, and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is married with one child, and her only child doesn’t go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her brother). She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for five years, selling to all categories of people but on a retail basis seven days out of every week.  

She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice and bread. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to build her own house. Her major business challenges include thieves and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda.  

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees for her brother.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice and bread.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica sells provisions in Eguafo near Elmina. 

Monica has received no formal education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer in their community. 

Monica has been selling provisions for some time now. She is responsible for helping support her husband in paying their family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell in her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her provisions shop.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and has five children. She has received no formal education. Gloria sells provisions in Eguafo near Elmina. She has owned and operated her provisions shop for many years now. Her husband is enjoying a pension for years of work. Gloria uses her income to help support her husband with paying their family's general expenses. 

Gloria will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell in her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gloria plans to expand her provisions shop further.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a widow with three children. She is the bread winner in the family. She lives in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon. 
 
She has struggled in life to earn a living for her family. It was not easy on her to raise business capital until she saw GHAPE as a source of relief and became a beneficiary. This is her third year as a GHAPE member and her previous loan repayments were satisfactory. 

As a very hardworking lady, she plans to invest her loan in the cultivation of crops and poultry farming. She is highly convinced this business will succeed because she has been doing this activity for a very long time. 

She plans to use the profit from the business to pay for her children’s school fees, assist with her younger brother's apprentice fee, give good medicine to her children whenever they are sick and also to ensure they are fed well.
  
She prefers to receive loans from GHAPE because the rate of interest is low, the method of payment is comfortable and convenient and also because of the training GHAPE offers before disbursing her loan.

loans.use: purchase seedlings and three-week-old chicks.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is married and has four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and  school fees.     

She has a business of selling herbal medicine and has been in this business for four years, selling to all categories of people on retail. She works from her home six days out of every week.   

She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more locally made cough syrups and other herbal medicines. She is aspiring to invest in used clothes and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more locally made cough syrups and other medicines.

loans.name: Ngwe Emilia

texts.en:
Ngwe Emilia is married and has six children, three of them below the age of 15. They live in a three-room apartment house in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon.

She has encountered challenges in life including the sickness of her mother, an accident that almost took away her life, the death of her brother -- an incident that she hates thinking of -- and also she was attacked by arm robbers. Among all of these problems, she also faces a problem of inadequate capital to start up a business. 

Given a loan, she plans to buy three-week-old chicks and fowl feed. She knows this activity will succeed because she has been doing it for a very long period and her community will provide a ready market for her products and more still. She has a large market due to increasing numbers in the population and increasing demand for her products. This activity will help the community in that they will have quality fowls at affordable prices.   

She plans to use the profits generated from this activity to pay tuition fees for her children in school and also to meet their basic needs such as hospital bills.

loans.use: to purchase three-week-old chicks and fowl feed.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is single and has no dependents. She has received no formal education. 

Emelia sells the traditional African dish banku, made of mashed corn and cassava. Emelia also sells the meat know as coat (smoked cow hide) to provide her customers with a complete meal. Emelia sells her traditional favorite dish in the community of Eguafo near Elmina. She has prepared and sold food in this area for some time now. 

Emelia uses her income to support herself and pay all her own expenses. Emelia will use the loan to purchase more ingredients necessary to prepare her banku recipe and coat meat to accompany her prepared meals. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emelia plans to develop her prepared food business further.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients necessary to prepare her banku recipe and coat meat to accompany her prepared meals.

loans.name: Esther Bih Tantoh

texts.en:
Esther Bih Tantoh is married and a mother of nine children. They live in a five-room apartment in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon. 

She has encountered some major challenges in life such as the death of her uncle, her inability to sponsor her children in school and to raise business capital. All these made life difficult for her. 

But now she has a little relief thanks to GHAPE. She came to know about GHAPE in 1999 after a long struggle to catch up with life.

She plans to invest her loan in the purchase of seedlings like beans, corn, cocoyam and potatoes. She is convinced the business will succeed because of the experience she has in the activity, and also she has a fertile piece of land where she will cultivate her crops.

She plans to use the profit from her loan to pay tuition fees for her children and to improve on the standard of living of her family, but most of the profit from the business will be ploughed back in to the business.

She prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married and has two children. She has received no formal education. 

Nancy sells traditional African fabrics in Eguafo near Elmina. Nancy has been selling fabrics for some time now. Her husband is a farmer in their community. Nancy uses her income to support her husband with their family's general accommodation bills. 

Nancy will use the loan to purchase a greater variety and quantity of fabrics to sell in the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nancy plans to increase her working capital and expand her fabric sales.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety and quantity of fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells the traditional favorite dish, kenkey, in Eguafo near Elmina. Kenkey is a mashed corn dough that is usually wrapped in banana leaves and served with a variety of pepper sauces and fish.  

Efua has received no formal education. She is a widow and has nine children. Efua has been selling kenkey for many years now. She is responsible for supporting herself and her many children. She also saves for her and her children’s future. 

Her loan will be used to buy more corn needed to prepare her kenkey recipe. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her kenkey selling trade.

loans.use: to buy more corn needed to prepare her kenkey recipe.

loans.name: Penn Pauline

texts.en:
Penn Pauline is married, with four children, and they live in a seven-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.

Penn Pauline has faced many challenges in life, among which are the death of her sister in the labor room, during delivery; the death of her brother after a severe sickness; and inadequate capital to setup and finance a business of her own.

Nine times, Penn Pauline has taken and repaid her loans and she says that, with the new loan requested, she will expand her firewood, beans, groundnuts, egusi, rice, and groundnut oil sales in her quarter. She is positive this business will succeed because she has been doing it for a long time, has experience, knows the techniques of the business, and the demand for firewood in her locality is very high.

With the profit from the loan, Penn Pauline will educate her children, take care of her family's medication, and cater for other family needs. She says a Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) loan is preferable because of low interest rates on loans and gradual repayment intervals.

loans.use: to expand her firewood, beans, groundnut, egusi, rice, and groundnut oil business.

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en:
Mr. Batbileg is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and two daughters in newly built house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Monh-Erdene, stays home taking care of their baby, Hongorzul, age 3. His daughter Altanzul, age 9, goes to a local primary school. 

He has been running his mobile phone repair service business since 2010. He is now planning to start to sell mobile phones and is requesting a loan of 5,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to import mobile phones from Erlian, China, to sell to local customers. He is a hardworking, welcoming and responsible man.

loans.use: to import mobile phones from Erlian, China, to sell to local customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Easter season.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells bush meat in Eguafo near Elmina. Aba has received no formal education. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a farmer. Aba has been selling bush meat for several years now. She is responsible for helping her husband in paying the family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of highly desired bush meat to sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to to grow her meat selling enterprise further.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of highly desired bush meat to sell in the market.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a 47-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 28 years now he has been teaching. With his salary savings he has been able to buy land for farming and pay school fees for his children. Low salary pay that can hardly meet his family's basic needs is his major challenge, while his dream is to venture into commercialized agriculture. Josephat intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is a 38-year-old, married man, with seven children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

After realizing that farming alone could not help him in meeting the daily needs of his family, due to the seasonal nature, he decided to set up a retail shop. Like most traders, he is faced with challenges of price fluctuation and high license fees, while his desire is to educate his children and own a wholesale shop. 

Selly intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets, sugar, soap, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy  iron sheets, sugar, soap, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 33-year-old, married man, with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

For ten years, he has been teaching and he also runs a retail shop to earn more income. Being the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University and build a permanent residential house for the family. The meager salary that he earns, coupled with price fluctuations, affects his business plan, while his desire is to expand his business to new markets. 

Moses intends to use the loan to buy construction materials, such sand and bricks, for building his residential house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such sand and bricks, for building his residential house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 35-year-old, married man, with seven children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Three years ago, he decided to set up a bar in order to earn a living. With the proceeds, he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. Being the good father that he is, he desires to see his children attain degrees as minimum qualification and to build a residential house for the family, while his business plan is to own a hotel. 

Peter intends to use the loan to buy construction materials, such as cement and poles.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement and poles.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 30-year-old married man with two children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a teacher for nine years. Patrick was inspired into service by his desire to work with young people. His challenges include a low salary.

Patrick is requesting a loan to buy land for farming. In the future, his plan is to venture into commercialized agriculture.

loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is Abu, a 32-year-old married father with children ages ten years and ten months. In 2003, Abu established his used clothing business to generate income to provide for his family. Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, Abu earns about 800,000 SLL every month. 

Abu is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to purchase more used clothing for his business. He hopes his loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Abu plans to educate children to the university level and build a home for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more used clothing for his business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Adama who is married with four children, aged five, 10, 18 and 21. She established her palm oil and garri business in 2001. Adama began her business because she is not educated and did not want to be dependent on anyone for her survival. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are businesswomen, domestic housewives, and other community members. Adama is hardworking and she works seven days a week and 10 hours a day to earn about 1,200,000 SLL every month. Her greatest business challenge is the high cost of transport. 

Adama is requesting a 4,500,000 SLL loan to buy more palm oil and bags of garri in large quantities to sell. She hopes to increase her profit to 900,000 SLL monthly. In the future, Adama plans to build her own house, improve her business, and provide a quality education to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy garri and palm oil

loans.name: Sabjesia

texts.en:
Sabjesia is 50 years old and married with four children. For the past eight years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling Avon. Sabjesia works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF.

Sabjesia is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, soap, eggs, noodles, and other products. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soap, eggs, noodles, and other products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married and works hard to support her family. For the past nine years, she has operated a general store business in the Philippines. Victoria has successfully repaid her previous loan.

Victoria is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, and other products. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, and other products

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marlene works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from rice farming and raising livestock. Marlene is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetable business.

Marlene successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her buy-and-sell vegetable, rice farming, and livestock-raising businesses.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gavina Deysis

texts.es:
Gavina de 58 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos. Originaria de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona d occidente del país. Gavina se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar sus estudios. Debido a que desde temprana edad tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.  Y luchar  día  a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracia a  su espíritu de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace diez años; una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shapoo, sobre de salsa de tomate, arroz, frijoles, jugos, pan, huevos, sal, azúcar, leche. La rutina de trabajo de Gavina es de unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles. Gavina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Gavina is 58 years old, and is a single mother with two children. She is originally from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the western part of the country. Gavina is characterized as a hardworking, responsible woman with a desire for self improvement. Unfortunately, she could not complete her studies because of a lack of economic resources, and because she had to work from an early age to help with household expenses. She struggles day by day to offer the best future to her children. 

Thanks to her spirit for moving forward, she has had a grocery store located in her home for 10 years. This is a small shop that sells consumable products in small quantities such as envelopes of coffee, envelopes of shampoo, envelopes of tomato sauce, rice, beans, juices, bread, eggs, salt, sugar and milk. Gavina's work routine involves about 12 hours daily selling her products, an activity which she undertakes with great pleasure.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to replenish her business in the buying and selling of consumable products. Gavina is grateful for the help offered by Kiva lenders to people with scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to help them obtain decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and replenish her grocery store with the purchase of consumable items such as envelopes of coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, rice, beans, juices, bread, eggs, salt, sugar and milk

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is married and has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past 10 years, and she works hard to support her family. 

Melanie is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Adbenhojuriza

texts.en:
Adbenhojuriza is 25 years old and married with two children. For the past year, she has been selling footwear in the Philippines. Adbenhojuriza works very hard to provide for her family.

Adbenhojuriza is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of shoes to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Noraida

texts.en:
Noraida is 25 years old and married with five children who are in school. For the past five years, she has been a rice farmer in the Philippines and she earns additional income running a general store, selling food, and raising cattle. 

Noraida is requesting a 23,000 PH loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She works tirelessly to attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Norva

texts.en:
Norva is 33 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. For the past three years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Norva works very hard to provide for her family. 

Norva is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy vegetables, rice, and additional items such as onions, shampoo, sugar, eggs, milk, energy drinks, and other products. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, rice, onions, shampoo, sugar, eggs, milk, energy drinks, and other products

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 64 years old and widowed with 10 children. She lives in the Philippines and is a farmer who has raised pigs for the past three years. She has been a member of PMPC for seven years. 

Marianita is requesting a loan to purchase five sacks of pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of pig feed

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 42 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc (NWTF) to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell cattle and farming rice.

Rebecca successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig-raising, buy-and-sell cattle, and rice farming businesses. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sandra Vanessa

texts.es:
Sandra Vanessa, casada con 45 años de edad, originaria de León, lugar que está ubicada en la zona de occidente del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar  estudios. Ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 

Gracias a su espiritud  y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, ubicada en su casa de habitación, desde hace 6 años que se dedica a dicha actividad.  Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles, y en cantidades pequeña como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, arroz, azúcar, leche, frijoles, pan, huevos, detergente. Ella dedica aproximadamente a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Sandra agradece la ayuda que los  inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sandra Vanessa is married and 45 years old. She is native to León, a place that is located in the western zone of the country. She is known for being a hard-working and responsible woman with a desire for personal self-improvement. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources she could not pursue her studies, since from a very young age she had to work to help with home expenses.

Thanks to her spirit and her desire to come out ahead she has a convenience store situated in her home. For six years she has worked in this business. A convenience store is a small store that sells grocery items and goods in small quantities like coffee packets, shampoo packets, rice, sugar, milk, beans, bread, eggs, and detergent. She works in her business 12 hours a day, an activity that she performs with pleasure. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in her business capital and supply her convenience store so that in the near future she can obtain a better income.  Sandra is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified means of working.

loans.use: to invest in business capital and supply her convenience store through the purchase of grocery items such as coffee, shampoo, rice, sugar, milk, beans, bread, eggs, and detergent.

loans.name: Romelie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Romelie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish-vending. Romelie is borrowing PHP 23,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional frozen foods to sell for her buy-and-sell frozen foods business.

Romelie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Retamas De Huayrapata Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento RETAMAS DE HUAYRAPATA está  compuesto por once integrantes diez mujeres y un  varón,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Elizabeth tiene 40 años casada con dos hijos que tienen  las edades de 25 y 15 años,  ella se dedica  a la  venta de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en localidad de el Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elizabeth va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de productos  por mayor para surtir su tienda  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Elizabeth va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, ya que esta época es de mucha demanda,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en: The "Retamas de Huayrapata" communal bank has 11 members - ten women and one man.  The president of the bank is Elizabeth, who is 45 years old and married with two children, aged 15 and 25 years.  Elizabeth makes a living selling staple goods such as groceries, sweets, soft drinks and a variety of items in her small shop in the town of Torno.  This loan is her first cycle with the institution and Elizabeth will use it to buy a variety of products in bulk to stock up her store, thus providing a variety of products to her customers.  She is applying for the loan to continue improving her business.  Elizabeth will use the profits to keep buying products and so increase her income as there is currently a lot of demand.  Her wish is for her store to have a stock room so as to provide better services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products in bulk to stock up her store.

loans.name: Waccema

texts.en:
Waccema is 33 years old and married with three children.

Waccema works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

Waccema has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling gasoline and diesel.

Waccema successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and buy and sell gasoline and diesel.

Waceema aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Liezel requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like coffee, canned goods, spices, noodles, etc.

Liezel has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like coffee, canned goods, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Reyna De Jesús

texts.es:
Doña Reyna de Jesús habita en la comarca La Palma ubicada a 10 km del municipio de El Sauce, es casada, madre de cinco hijos dos de ellos a su cargo, se ha dedicado por más de veinte años a impartir clases de primaria a niños de las comarcas aledañas a la Palma, profesión que le ha permitido preparar a sus hijos profesionalmente.

 A pesar de haber sido criada en el campo es una mujer luchadora y forjadora que le gusta sobresalir y que sus hijos hagan lo mismo.

Por primera vez está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel, ya que se dio cuenta que hay inversionistas del extranjero que prestan dinero a las personas de escasos recursos que quieren cumplir sus sueños y ella es una de esas personas que quiere mejorar su vivienda.

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de construir una pila de concreto para que sus animales beban agua y evitar llevarlos hasta el río.

 Con este crédito pretende comprar cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra.
Confía en que estos inversionistas aprobarán su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión donde quedará eternamente agradecida.
texts.en:
Reyna Jesús lives in the La Palma district, ten kilometres from the town of El Sauce.  She is married and the mother of five children, two of whom she still looks after.  Reyna has been working for over twenty years as a primary school teacher in the outskirts of La Palma and this profession has allowed her to prepare her own children for the professional world.

In spite of being brought up in the countryside, Reyna is a plucky and strong woman who likes to overcome obstacles and for her children to do the same.

For the first time, she is now applying for a loan for Ceprodel as she realised that investors from other countries are loaning their money to people with few financial resources to those who want to achieve their dreams.  Reyna is one of those people and she wants to improve her home.

She currently needs to build a concrete trough for her animals to drink water without having to take them all the way to the river.

With this loan to plans to buy cement, iron and to pay for labour.

She trusts that investors will approve her loan so that she can make her investment.  She will be eternally grateful.

loans.use: to buy cement. iron and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Jose Modesto

texts.es: El señor Jose habitante del munucipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos, el trabaja como guarda de seguridad para una empresa privada, sus planes a futuro es poder terminar su casa para poder darles a sus hijos las condiciones necesarios, su mayor dificultad es que no puede recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para la compra de materiales ya que con los gastos del hogar y  los gasto del colegio de sus hijos se le dificulta un poco, con este Financiamiento comprara los materiales como: Cemento, Bloques, Arena, Piedrin para empezar a construir su sueño, Agradece el apoyo de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva por la confianza brindada.
texts.en: Jose lives in the county of Ticuantepe with his wife and children. He works as a security guard for a private company. His future plan is to be able to to finish his home to be able to provide his children the basic condition to live. His biggest challenge is not being able to compile the money needed to buy the materials at one time. The household expenses and the costs of school for his children both make it a little more difficult. With the loan he will buy materials such as cement, blocks, sand, stone, to be able to build his dream. He is thankful for the help of Afodenic and Kiva for the confidence invested in him.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José Francisco es un señor Sauceño que habita en una comarca aledaña a dicho municipio donde tiene 12 años de residir, casado con cuatro hijos uno de ellos en edad escolar.

Actualmente se desempeña como Operario de limpieza donde a diario desde muy temprano desde las 4 de la mañana inicia barriendo las calles principales de dicha localidad y a pesar que gana tan poco ejerce su trabajo con entusiasmo porque es el que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.

Le da gracias a Dios por tener un techo digno donde vivir y un trabajo cuando hay muchas personas en Nicaragua que no tienen empleo mucho menos que comer.

Está solicitando un crédito a los inversionistas de kiva  para que a través de Ceprodel le presten para comprar medicina y realizarse exámenes médicos, ya que últimamente se ha sentido mal de salud por lo que quiere mejorar para rendir mejor en su labor.

Está muy agradecido por este apoyo de estos inversionistas de buen corazón que a diario prestan a personas de bajos recursos de todo el mundo y que es una bendición de Dios.
texts.en:
José Francisco is a man from Sauce who has been living in a district adjacent to said municipality for the last 12 years.  He’s married and has four children one of which is school age.  He’s currently employed as a maintenance man.  He starts work every day at four in the morning sweeping one of the city’s main streets and despite earning so little he does his job with enthusiasm because it allows him to provide daily bread for his home.  He thanks God for having a proper roof to live under and a job because many people in Nicaragua have no jobs and not even enough to eat.

He’s asking for this loan from Kiva lenders through Ceprodel to buy medicine and to have some medical tests done because he’s not been feeling well recently and he wants to be better to do his job better.  He’s very grateful for this support from lenders who from the kindness of their hearts lend daily to people of limited resources all over the world which is a blessing from God.

loans.use: to buy medicine and have some medical tests done.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 38 years old, married with four children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business, growing and selling vegetables in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over three years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Solaya

texts.en:
Solaya is 46 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling 'nipa' (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Solaya has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for eight years and also earns income from buying and selling paddy rice  and dried coconut meat.

Solaya aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Merle is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and pay for laborers' salaries for her sugarcane business.

Merle has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for laborers' salaries for her sugarcane business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 58 years old, married, and has six children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She also earns additional income from selling charcoal.

Nida is requesting a loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional livestock to raise.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 57 years old, married, and has one child. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Susan is requesting a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stock such as shampoo, soap, spices, eggs, and soft drinks.  In the future Susan would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, soap, spices, eggs, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Angel Roberto

texts.es:
Angel tiene 47 años es casado tiene 7 hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos en chimbo provincia de bolivar.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz suave, el credito lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos fertilizantes y fungicidas,  el credito le ayudado a comprar lo necesario para empezar la siembra.

Angel tiene el sueño de comprar terenos para seguir sembrando en los tiepos libres de gusta caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Angel is 47 years old.  He is married and has seven children.  He lives with his wife and children in the Chimbo province in Bolívar.

Angel makes a living in agriculture, growing sweetcorn.  He is applying for a loan to buy seeds, fertilisers and fungicides.  The loan will help him to buy the necessary to begin planting.

Angel's dream is to buy land to continue to sowing his crops.  In his free time he likes to go for walks with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers and fungicides.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, spices, canned goods, etc.

Nenita has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio is 68 years old and married. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He owns and operates a furniture making, which he has been doing for over nine years.  He earns 25,000 PHP a month. 

Anastacio is requesting a loan for 30,000 PHP, which he will to purchase additional items to use such as wood. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. He joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to use such as wood.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is married and has three children.  She has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. 

Ana is requesting her seventh loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional materials like iron, wood, and charcoal for her blacksmith business.  Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Joséphine est une femme de 56 ans , veuve et mère de 02 enfants. Elle possède et gère une boutique de où elle vend des sous vêtements de 4 ans dans un quartier de la ville. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour pouvoir renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant les sous vêtements pour femme afin de palier à la demande de sa clientèle. Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'accroître son activité et de subvenir à ses besoins (nutrition, logement)
texts.en: Josephine is a 56-year old woman, a widow and the mother of two. She owns and manages a local store in which she has been selling underwear for four years. She is seeking this loan in older to bolster her stock and buy women’s underwear in order to meet her customer’s expectations. The resulting revenues will allow her to expand her business and provide for her needs (food, lodging).

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Hugo es transportista del servicio público (taxista , su nivel de educación es  secundaria, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando 3  habitaciones en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de machimbre en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.

Hugo trabaja más de 8 horas al día para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua y otros.

El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital ya que comprará el taxi que maneja, pues es solo alquilado, y  así mejorar sus ingresos.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Hugo is a taxi driver.  He completed high school and lives at his parents house, using three of their rooms that are made of bricks and wooden floors.  The house is in the Bajo Llojeta area of the city of La Paz.

Hugo works eight hours a day to cover costs such as food, water and electricity.

Hugo needs this loan to increase his capital as he will buy the taxi that he drives as he currently only rents it.  Buying it will improve his income.

This is the first time he has borrowed from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy the taxi that he drives, which he is currently renting.

loans.name: Victoria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Victoria del Carmen es una mujer de 52 años, soltera, madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos a su cargo estudiando en la universidad y un nieto también en edad escolar, se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a impartir clases de primaria en un colegio del municipio de El Sauce.

Es una mujer luchadora que además de dedicarse a esta actividad elabora y vende comida en los estadios de dicho municipio los fines de semana todo con el objetivo de obtener ingresos para pagar y dotar de todo lo necesario para sus hijos en la universidad con el fin de que lleguen a ser unos profesionales.

Hoy en la actualidad está solicitando un crédito para comprar una lavadora, para ahorrar tiempo ya que con sus ingresos no cubre para pagar una empleada doméstica que le haga los quehaceres del hogar por lo que ella aun trabajando tiene que dividir su tiempo para cocinar, lavar, planchar ropa y comprando una lavadora es una forma de ahorrar tiempo.

 tiene esperanza que le financiarán este crédito a través de Ceprodel para adquirir este bien, ya que es la única alternativa de hacerlo porque los salarios en Nicaragua son muy bajos.
texts.en:
Victoria del Carmen is a 52-year-old, single woman, mother of three children two of which are still in her care and attending university; she also has a school-age grandson.  She’s spent most of her life teaching at a municipal elementary school in El Sauce.

She’s a tenacious woman who in addition to working in this profession also makes and sells food in the city’s stadiums on the weekend in order to earn extra income to be able to cover everything needed for her children’s university education so they can become professionals.

She’s currently requesting a loan to buy a washing machine to save time because her income is insufficient to pay for a domestic employee to do her housework and she has to split her time between working, cooking, washing, ironing clothes and buying a washing machine is a way of saving time.  She hopes the loan will be financed through Ceprodel because this is the only alternative she has given the low salaries in Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Joven

texts.en: Joven is 31 years old and married with two children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport service to earn a living. He has been with his business for over three years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Now he has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase spare parts. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 63 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Cristina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Cristina has been farming sugarcane for 43 years and also earns additional income from food-vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es:
El Sauce es un pueblo caluroso que queda al occidente del departamento de León rodeado de montañas florecidas y ríos caudalosos que hacen del lugar un atractivo turístico.

El él habita Alma Nidia, una profesora de 45 años que se ha dedicado más de veinte años al magisterio, profesión que le ha permitido tener su propia vivienda con la ayuda de su esposo y preparar a sus dos hijas.
En la actualidad imparte clases de primaria a niños de un colegio de la localidad.

Está solicitando un crédito para pagar módulo universitario de su hija la que acaba de terminar las clases de la universidad con el fin de obtener su título universitario como profesional.
Como madre responsable quiere dejarles como herencia a sus hijas una carrera universitaria para que se defiendan en la vida.

Por tal motivo solicita este crédito para llevar a cabo esta inversión, ya que con los bajos salarios que se gana en Nicaragua no se pueden cumplir muchos sueños.

Confía que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel le financiarán este crédito para poder cumplir su sueño de ver preparadas profesionalmente a sus hijas.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a hot town located in the west of León Department surrounded by flower-covered mountains and mighty rivers that make the place attractive to tourists.  Alma Nidia lives there.  She’s a 45-year-old teacher who has more than 20 years’ experience teaching.  This profession has made it possible for her to own a house and with her husband’s help has been able to educate her two daughters.  She currently works as an elementary school teacher at a local school.

She’s asking for a loan to pay her daughter’s university fees; she’s recently finished her course work at the university aimed at earning her professional degree.  Like a responsible mother, she wants to leave her daughters an inheritance consisting of a university career so they can fend for themselves in life.

This is why she’s asking for a loan in order to reach this goal because the low salaries common in Nicaragua prevent many dreams from coming true.  She trusts that Kiva lenders through Ceprodel will finance this loan so she can reach her dream of seeing her daughters become professionals.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Keila Jocabed

texts.es:
La joven Keila Jocabed es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, madre de un niño, quien a temprana edad formó su hogar siendo una mujer de buenos principios, trabajadora y luchadora, que a pesar de ganar tan poco lucha día a día por hacer un excelente trabajo.
Se desempeña como Trabajadora social para un proyecto de dicho municipio donde su labor principal es alfabetizar a los adultos sobre todo del campo que no saben leer ni escribir, cabe señalar que es un trabajo admirable de mucha paciencia enseñar a estas personas que son muy humildes.
Esta joven diario camina largos kilómetros para visitar casa por casa a sus posibles alumnos y por tal motivo está solicitando su primer crédito en Ceprodel para comprar una bicicleta como medio de transporte para evitar estas largas caminatas.
Confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel le aprobarán su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión donde le quedará eternamente agradecida, ya que estos créditos son de mucha ayuda para las personas asalariadas sobre todo las que ganan tan poco.
texts.en:
Young Keila Jocabed is from El Sauce.  She’s the mother of a little boy.  She formed her home at a young age and she’s a hardworking, tenacious woman of good principles who despite earning little strives daily to do a good job.

She works as a social worker for a municipal project where her main job is teaching adults especially in rural areas to read and write.  It’s worth pointing out that this is admirable work requiring much patience to teach these people because they are very humble people.

She walks long kilometers daily to visit her potential students house to house and this is why she’s asking Ceprodel for her first loan to buy a bicycle to use as a means of transportation in order to avoid these long walks.

She trusts in God that Kiva lenders through Ceprodel will approve her loan request so she can make this investment.  She will be eternally grateful because these loans are of great help to salaried people who earn so little.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz.  Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas y fungicidsas para el cuidado de los cultivos

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia y las plagas. 
El sueño dinero para salir de viaje.
 
En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Carlos is thirty-two years old and lives in a common-law relationship.  He has no children.  He lives with his partner in the Ventanas Canton, in the province of Los Ríos.  He is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, which is located in the San Francisco area of the parish of San Juan; the members work in agricultural jobs.    

Carlos makes a living in agriculture, growing rice and corn.  He is requesting a loan in order to invest in agriculture by buying seeds, fertilizers, agricultural manure, and fungicides for the care of his crops.

The challenges he frequently faces are from competition and pests.

His dream is to have money in order to go on a trip.  In his free time he likes to play sports with his friends in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, agricultural manure, and fungicides for the care of his crops.

loans.name: Chalita

texts.en:
Chalita is married and has seven children.  She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.  She alsoo earns additional income from a general store.  

Chalita is requestiing her 19th loan from NWTF for 29,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Jose tiene 66 años vive en Sinabamba perteneciente a Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar,es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y 2 nietos. 

Jose ya no pertenece a la ventanilla Sinabamba por que ahorra realiza los credito en forma individual, el se dedica a la siembra de maiz en terrenos propios, el dinero lo va a invertir en la comprar de abonos urea y semilla para la siembra.

el sueño es tener dinero para poder descansar y que a los hijos no le falten nada.

en los tiempos libres le gusta conversar con los nietos.
texts.en: José, 66, lives in Sinabamba belonging to Chimbo, Bolívar Province.   He’s married and has four children.  He lives with his wife and two grandchildren.  He’s no longer a member of the Sinabamba communal bank so is now taking out an individual loan.  He works growing corn on land of his own.  He will use the money to buy sacks of urea and seeds to plant.  His dream is to have money so he can rest and his children will have everything they need.  He enjoys chatting with his grandchildren in his free time.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Maritza del Carmen  es profesora docente de unos de los colegios públicos de la ciudad de león desde hace más de 20 años, inicia su labores de 7 am  a 3 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes,  siendo este trabajo el sustento de su familia.

La Señora Maritza de Carmen esta necesitando para la compra de útiles escolares y matricula para el ingreso de su hijos a clases por lo que se acercó a ceprodel  para solicitar  apoyo y así resolver  dicha necesidad.
texts.en:
Maritza del Carmen has been a teacher in public schools in the city of León for more than 20 years.  She works from 7am until 3pm, Monday through Friday.  She supports her family by means of this job.

Maritza del Carmen needs to buy school supplies and pay tuition fees for her children to start school and this is why she approached Ceprodel to request support to meet this need.

loans.use: to buy clothes, school supplies and to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 43 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Enriqueta is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to pay for her laborer's salary for the maintenance of her sugarcane business.

Enriqueta has been farming sugarcane for 27 years and also earns additional income from a general store and food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for her laborer's salary for the maintenance of her sugarcane business

loans.name: Rosa Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosa  tiene 53 años de edad es soltera, vive con el papá y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Se dedica a la agricultura. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Babahoyo. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de cacao, fertilizantes y abonos para el cultivo

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia. El sueño es tener dinero para comprar mas terreno para seguir sembrando

En los tiempos ver la television y escuchar musica
texts.en:
Rosa, 53, is single living with her father and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the San Juan communal bank located in Recinto San Francisco which is part of San Juan Parish; they work in agriculture.

She works in agriculture and makes her purchases and sales in Babahoyo.  She’s requesting the loan to buy cocoa bean seeds, fertilizer and manure for her crops.  The challenge she faces frequently is competition.  Her dream is to have money to buy more land to continue farming.  She enjoys watching television and listening to music in her free time.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Meda

texts.en: Meda is 50 years old, married with one child. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over five years and earns 8,000PHP every month. In 2010, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like like canned goods, sugar, coffee, shampoo, and soap.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, su nivel de educación es  secundaria, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando 3  habitaciones en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de machimbre en la zona de Pasankery de la ciudad de La Paz.

Verónica atiende su tienda más de  8 horas al día, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua, educación de su hija y otros

El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de su capital de trabajo, pues comprará insumos como ser harina, azúcar, fideo y otros al por mayor para reducir el costo y mejorar su ingreso.

El sueño de Verónica es que su hija termine sus estudios y ampliar su negocio.

Es la segunda vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Verónica has a neighborhood store at home.  She completed secondary school.  She lives in her parents’ house occupying three bedrooms with brick walls and wood flooring.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Pasankery zone.

Verónica tends to her store for more than 8 hours daily in order to cover food, electricity, water and education costs for her daughter and others.  She needs the loan to increase working capital.  She will buy supplies like flour, sugar, noodles and others at wholesale to reduce costs and improve income.

Verónica’s dream is that her daughter completes her schooling and to expand the business.  This is her second loan with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita tiene 47 años tiene un hijo de la edad de 28 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Villa Fátima este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es por la época de clases ya que su tienda se encuentra cerca a un colegio y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería para comprar material escolar cuadernos hojas bolígrafos, la Sra.  Margarita enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona y en la misma calle donde está su negocio, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda más grande y surtida, asi poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita is 47, and has a 28-year-old son. She sells basic household necessities in her neighborhood store located in the Villa Fatima area. This loan is her first with the institution. She is going to use this loan to purchase merchandise for stocking her store. 

Her reason for requesting this loan is the back-to-school season, as her store is located near a school and that's when her sales increase. She needs to stock up on merchandise, by buying school supplies such as notebooks, paper and pens. 

Margarita faces challenges in her business such as competition, as there are various similar stores in the area and on the same street where her business is. She is going to use the profits to purchase more merchandise for stocking her store and to continue growing more each day. 

Her wish for her business is to continue selling and to have a larger and better-stocked store. This way she will be able to make her business grow.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for supplying her store.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: A very humble and loving mother of four children and to her husband Edgar, Edna has a general store selling a variety of products in their village. She makes sure that she can sustain the needs of her family, most especially the needs of her children in school. Edna is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 to buy canned goods, shampoo, soap, spices, and candies for her store. She dreams that she can help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo, soap, spices, and candies for her store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old.  She is married and has three children, one of whom is in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a business, selling vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been in business for 12 years.  Erlinda has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional vegetables to stock and to sell.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to stock and to sell.

loans.name: Flor Clara

texts.es:
Flor tieme 58 años de edad es casada tiene 6 hijos vive con el esposo y la nieta ya que los hijos viven fuera de la ciudad.

Flor ya no pertenece a la ventanilla Sinabamba ya que ella se decidio para realizar los creditos individuales. Solicita el credito para la coprar de semillas de maiz, fertilizantes y abonos, ya que ella se dedica a la siembra de maiz.

El credito le ayudado a aumentar la produccion, el sueño de Flor es comprar tierras para seguir sembrando. En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a jugar con la nieta.
texts.en:
Flor is 58 years old, married, and has six children. She lives with her husband and their granddaughter, because her children have moved away now.

Flor is no longer a member of the Sinabamba communal bank as she has decided to apply for loans independently. She is requesting the loan to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and manure to help her to grow corn.

Her previous loan helped her to increase production. Flor’s dream is to buy land so that she can continue sowing corn. In her free time, Flor likes to play outside with her granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fungicides.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: El joven Jose David habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en la comunidad llamada Dirita, casado con tres hijos, trabajador y luchador ya que para el su familia es lo mas importante y por eso el quiere darle siempre lo mejor, el trabaja como Ebanista y gracias a su esfuerzo se encarga d elos gastos del  hogar su compañera le ayuda ya que es trabaja como domestica para una casa privada, con este  credito comprara materiales de Construccion como: Cemento, Arena, Bloques etc. para terminar de construir su casa. Agradece mucho el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le estan brindando.
texts.en: Young José David lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe in a community called Dirita.  He’s married with three children.  He’s tenacious and hardworking because his family is what’s most important for him and he wants to give them the best always.  He works as a cabinet maker and thanks to his efforts is able to cover household expenses with help from his spouse who works as a domestic employee in a private home.
