Luis is married and has three children, ages 3, 5, and 7.  He has a sixth-grade education and works in agriculture.

He's a very hardworking person who's well known in his community.  He grows rice and sorghum.  He also has three dairy cows and takes care of a piece of property.  He lives in a house located on that property, but he wants to build his own house so he's asking Integral for a loan to make his dream of giving his family a decent home come true.

In the photograph, behind the silo that holds the grain he has harvested are some poultry, water reservoirs (plastic recipients or barrels, because he doesn't have potable running water at home), a dirt floor, and a clay tile roof held up by rustic wood (tree trunks).  This demonstrates his need to have a home that gives his family shelter and minimal security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Reinaldo es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, tiene 45 años y se dedica a la construcción y su esposa se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Anteriormente el señor vendía helados y luego aprendió el oficio de albañilería, y hoy en día ya se hizo de muy buena fama, ya que hace muy buenos trabajos y siempre se destaca en ello.
El es una persona que trabaja duro por ayudar a su familia y por darles todo lo que necesitan y de esa forma evitar que tengan que pasar por necesidades.
El crédito lo utilizó para comprar ladrillos, tejas, cemento y arena hacer una pieza más, ya que con ello podrá seguir con su trabajo y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Reinaldo is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  He is 45 years old and works in construction.  His wife sells fruits and vegetables.  Previously, Reinaldo sold ice cream and then he learned the bricklaying trade.  Today, he has already earned a very good reputation because he does very good work and it always stands out.  He is a person who works very hard to support his family and provide everything that they need and in this way, prevents them from having to do without.  He will use the loan to purchase bricks, tiles, cement, and sand to build another room and this will enable him to continue working and supporting his family.  .

loans.use: to purchase bricks, tiles, cement, and sand

loans.name: Miguel Angel Coreas

texts.es:
Miguel, es sastre, aprendió el negocio de su familia, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 24 y 18 años de edad, depende económicamente de él. Miguel aprendió la sastrería hace 30 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana, hasta el momento no presenta dificultad realizar este oficio.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para complementar la construcción de un muro en la vivienda, esto le dará mayor seguridad para su familia y mejorar su condición en el hogar.
Los sueños de Miguel es poder tener una vivienda construida en la totalidad, para la comodidad de la familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a tailor. He learned the business from his family. He lives with his wife and two children who are 24 and 18 years old. They depend on him economically. Miguel learned tailoring 30 years ago. He works every day of the week. Up until now, no difficulty has arisen for this business.

He is requesting a loan to do construction on a wall in his home. This would give his family better security and improve the condition of the home.

Miguel's dream is to be able to have a completely finished home for his family's comfort.

loans.use: to do construction on a wall in his home.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 51-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has five grown children. The eldest is 31 and the youngest is 16 years old. 

Lydia has been in the food vending business for 25 years. She sells cassava cakes. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a farmer.

Lydia is requesting a loan to buy sugar, coconut and cassava. These are the ingredients in her cassava cakes. With this loan, she will be able to continue her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconut and cassava

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María, tiene la necesidad de aperturar otro negocio para los fines de semana en canchas deportivas, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos comestibles como gaseosas, agua, jugos, maíz, aceite, queso, carne y otros productos, con esto ella lograra instalar una venta de bebidas y pupusas en otro punto de la zona. 
Con el préstamo anterior María, tuvo una experiencia positiva, aumentaron sus ventas, su disponibilidad de dinero y la capacidad para pagar sus obligaciones, su familia está estable.
texts.en:
María needs to open another business for the weekends at sports fields. For this, she is requesting a new loan to purchase edibles such as sodas, water, juices, corn, cooking oil, cheese, meat, and other products. With this, she will open a stand to sell drinks and stuffed tortillas in another location in the area.

With Maria's earlier loan, Maria had a positive experience. She grew her sales, liquidity, and the ability to pay her bills. Her family is stable.

loans.use: purchase sodas, water, juices, corn, cooking oil, cheese, meat, and other products.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es una mujer joven de 31 años de edad casada que de su matrimonio tiene 3 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y estudian en diferentes grados de educación primaria. Junto a su esposo se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura a la siembra y cultivo de café en un terreno que agradecen a DIOS por ser propio el cual gracias al esfuerzo impuesto por mucho tiempo pudieron adquirirlo hace 4 años por medio de su suegro ya que el dio facilidades de pago. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo cursado hasta el 6 grado pero no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo financiero. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en el mercado local con vecinos, amigos y compradores de la zona donde ella habita. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 5 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en motocicleta para darle el mantenimiento al mismo.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y bombas de fumigación para sus cultivos de café ya que de esta forma ella podrá obtener una mejor cosecha y una mejor producción de calidad para su venta.

Su meta es lograr obtener una producción de calidad la cual traiga muchos beneficios para su familia y de esa forma poder utilizar las ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su propiedad de esa forma poder cumplir su sueño de ver a sus hijos graduados universitaria mente con carreras de provecho y puedan crear una empresa familiar.
texts.en:
Estela is a 31-year old young woman, married and mother of three minor children, who are studying in different grades at primary school. Together with her husband, she works in agriculture cultivating coffee in a plot that, thank to God, they own. After many years of hard work, they were able to buy it four years ago through her father-in-law, who gave them good payment conditions. Estela finished 6th grade in primary education and couldn't continue studying due to a lack of financial support. She sells her product in the local market to neighbors, friends and buyers in the area. Her crops are located 5km away from her home and they use the motorcycle to get there and maintain them. 

She's requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and fumigation pumps for her coffee crops. These will help her to obtain a better harvest and quality product to sell. Her goal is to have a product of good quality that will derive good profits for her family that she'll keep investing in her property, and to make her dream come true of seeing her children graduating from college with good degrees to start a family business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fumigation pumps for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo y en la venta de plátanos, vive con su padre en la misma vivienda, él está soltero, tiene cuatro años de estar produciendo en el negocio lo aprendió al comprar un terreno donde cultivan plátano, pipián y maíz al ver este cultivo fue de su agrado y por lo mismo se esmero en aprenderlo y seguir desarrollando.

Solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la siembra en la finca de plátanos, comprando abono, semilla, gasolina y pago de mano de obra, para preparar el terreno, ya que quiere aprovechar el terreno para continuar en la producción, esto le ayudará para quien tenga una fuente de ingreso y de trabajo, poder abastecer el mercado, espera no tener riesgos durante la producción y sus ganancias serían mayores ya que él terreno es propio.

La aspiración es crecer en el mercado, teniendo la oportunidad de proveer a quienes se dedican al menudeo de la venta de plátanos y poder mejorar su condición en el trabajo y sus ingresos personales.
texts.en:
José makes a living growing and selling bananas.  He's single and lives with his father in the same house.  He has been working in this business for four years.  He learned it when he bought a piece of land with banana, chili pepper, and corn crops.  He liked this crop and took pains to learn about it and continue developing it.

He's requesting a loan to be able to do the planting on his banana farm.  He's going to buy fertilizer, seed, and gasoline, and pay for labor to prepare the land, because he wants to make the most of the land to continue with the crop.

This will help him have a source of income and of work, and be able to supply the market.  He hopes that there won't be any danger during the production and that his profits will be greater since the land is his own.

He wants to grow in the market, have the opportunity to supply those who sell bananas retail, and be able to improve his job status and his personal income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and gasoline, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, lentes y artículos de temporada, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 15, 10 y 8 años de edad, todos ellos estudian, ella aprendió este negocio hace 5 años son la madre de su esposo, ahora lo realiza con su esposo, tienen un pick up para el transporte de mercadería, su horario es de 7:00am a 8:00 am, o dependiendo de la temporada.
Ella solicita un préstamo para surtir el negocio, comprando ropa para baño, como trajes de baño, calzonetas, bermudas, artículos flotantes, ropa de moda, esto le ayudara a vender más, para la temporada de verano, con las posibilidades de obtener mejores ganancias. La aspiración de María es tener un negocio fuerte, trabajando con dinero propio.
texts.en:
María sells new clothing, glasses and seasonal items.  She lives with her husband and their three children, who are 8, 10 and 15 years of age.  All of the children are in school.  

She learned this business 5 years ago with her mother-in-law.  Currently she runs the business with her husband.  They have a pickup truck to transport their merchandise. She commonly works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm, depending on the season.

She is seeking a loan in order to stock her business.  She will buy apparel for swimming, such as bathing suits, Bermuda shorts, other types of shorts, flotation devices, and fashion clothing.  This will help her to increase her sales for the summer season so that she can make better income.  Her dream is to have a strong, self-sustaining business.

loans.use: to buy bathing suits, Bermuda shorts, flotation devices, and fashion clothing.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila, de 62 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, está casada y tiene la compañía de su esposo y sus seis hijos quienes ya son adultos e independientes, juntos habitan su casa propia la cual obtuvo con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo.Lila, se dedica principalmente a la venta de todo tipo de bebidas de diversos tamaños, distintas marcas y diferentes sabores con los que sus clientes se refrescan y sacian la sed que el intenso clima de su región les origina. Tiene un congelador en donde coloca a diario las cervezas y gaseosas que va vendiendo durante el día en su hogar. Sus clientes principalmente son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 3 años y lo hace con ayuda de sus hijos. Comparte su trabajo con la siembra de yuca en su terreno ubicado a las afueras de la ciudad, tiene instalada 2 hectáreas con este cultivo y se encuentra en plena producción aunque necesita algunos detalles de manejo que requieren ser solucionados.
Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede disponer de su tiempo libre, además desea incrementar su negocio ya que considera que le genera muy buenas ganancias debido a que se encuentra muy bien ubicada y que con el tiempo aprendió a tratar bien a los clientes y eso hace que siempre vuelvan a su negocio .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3500 soles y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo . Con el monto solicitado comprará bebidas de todas las marcas y presentaciones además invertirá en la limpieza de su terreno sembrado con yuca.
texts.en:
Lila, 62 years old, is a friendly and hardworking woman. She is married and has the company of her husband and six children who are already adults and self-sufficient. They live together in their own home, which they earned through a lot of work and effort. Lila primarily works selling all types of drinks in a variety of sizes, brands, and flavors. Her customers use them to refresh themselves and satiate their thirst that comes from the intense climate in their region. She has a freezer where she stores each day the beers and sodas that she will sell during the day from her home. Her customers are mainly her neighbors, friends, and acquaintances. She has had this business for nearly three years and has developed it with the help of her children. She also works planting yucca on her land located on the outskirts of the city. She has two hectares planted with this crop and has full production, although she has some operating issues that need to be solved.

She really likes her work because she is able to use her free time. She also wants to grow her business because she sees that it is generating her very good income because it is so well located, and with time, she learned to treat her customers well, and this makes them always return to her shop. At this time, she is requesting S/. 3,500 soles and is very happy to know that she has the financial support to be able to continue growing her working capital. With the money requested, she will purchase drinks of all brands and packaging as well as invest in cleaning up her land that is planted with yucca.

loans.use: purchase refreshing beverages.

loans.name: Jose Wilfredo

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por mejorar el negocio, aumentando la variedad en ropa nueva, ya que han mejorado las ventas, se comprara pantalones, camisas, blusas, calcetines, ropa interior, esto le permitirá mejorar su condición en el comercio, por eso solicita un préstamo que le cubra la inversión.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo en el negocio, con más prendas de vestir, esto porque las ventas ha mejorado, ya que visita zonas donde los residentes son beneficiados con ayuda del gobierno a través de la red solidaria, en su familia los ingresos se han mantenido para cubrir las necesidades, sus deseos es ampliar el negocio y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Since he has increased his sales, José has decided to increase the variety of new clothing he sells.  He will buy shirts, blouses, pants, socks and underwear.  This will enable him to improve his financial situation.  For this reason he is seeking a loan so he can make his investment.

His previous loan made a positive impact on his business.  With more clothing to sell, his sales have increased.  He visits areas where the residents receive government benefits through social programs.

In his family his income covers their necessities.  His wish is to expand his business and build his own home.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, socks and underwear.

loans.name: Graciela Genoveva

texts.es:
Graciela, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de cereales, carnes, gas, agua en bolsa,  refrescos, y todo lo demás que sean necesarios para la venta diaria y así surtir la tienda, esto le ayudara a continuar trabajando.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que logro surtir el negocio, vender más y pagar los pendientes, en su hogar se mantiene su familia, esta ayuda sirve para la subsistencia, cubriendo lo más necesario.
texts.en:
Graciela is requesting a new loan, so she can purchase cereals, meat, natural gas, bagged water and soft drinks among other items necessary for daily sales and stock the store. This will help her to continue working.  
With her previous loan she considers that she managed to stock her business, increase her sales and pay debts.  At home she supports her family; therefore this loan will help her family subsistence by providing a way to cover their basic needs.

loans.use: Purchase cereals, meat, natural gas, bagged water and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, tiene 23 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de un año de edad, vive con sus padres, pero realiza los cultivos para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 3 años está trabajando en lo propio.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de tres sacos de abono, los cuales serán aplicados al cultivo, este financiamiento le ayudara para tener el recurso y aumentar la producción.
La aspiración de José es mejorar los ingresos, a través de ello mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who grows basic grains.  He is 23 years old and has a partner and a one-year-old son.  He lives with his parents and farms in order to help his family with the household expenses.  He has been running his own business for three years.

José is requesting this loan to buy three sacks of fertilizer which he will apply to his crops.  This loan will help him to have the resources he needs to increase his production.

José's goal is to improve his income.  In this way he will improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Taliilagi

texts.en: Taliilagi is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Taliilagi has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, a hose, a wheelbarrow, a pair of gloves, spades, baby cabbages and weedkiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Taliilagi hopes to improve her business and earn more profit to help her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy plants and gardening equipment.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Doña Maria Dolores, tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su familia en San Juan Pueblo.
Doña Maria hace 4 años que inicio un negocio de pulperia, viéndose en la necesidad de generar otro ingreso extra que le ayudara solventar los gastos diarios del hogar. Ella vende productos de la canasta básica, como arroz, frijoles, manteca, harina, maseca, huevos, embutidos, lácteos etc. Dice que desde que inicio le ha ido bien, tiene su propia clientela y sus ventas son buenas. Agradece el apoyo que le han dado y gracias a los prestamos su negocio se ha mantenido estable.
Es su tercer préstamo de 25,000 lempiras que lo necesita para comprar más producto como frijoles, arroz, maseca, harina, carnes etc. Para ofrecer a los clientes los productos que se necesitan a diario en el hogar.
Su meta principal es ayudar a sus hijos en la educación y lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores is 48 years old, married, has three children, and lives with her family in San Juan Pueblo.

Maria started her grocery store four years ago, seeing the need to generate extra income that would help her cover daily household expenses. She sells basic groceries such as rice, beans, butter, flour, cornmeal, eggs, cold meats, dairy products, etc. She says that since the start, things have been going well for her. She has her own clientele, and her sales are good. She is grateful for the support that you all have given her and, thanks to the loans, her business is staying stable.

This is her third loan of 25,000 lempiras that she needs to purchase more products such as beans, rice, butter, flour, meats, etc. These are to offer her customers that they need on a daily basis in their homes.

Her main goal is to help her children with their education and what they need.

loans.use: purchase products such as basic grains, beans, rice, sugar, flour, cornmeal, butter, beverages, eggs, etc. for selling.

loans.name: Manvel

texts.ru:
Манвелу 44 лет.Он женат и живет вместе с женой и двумья дочерьми в городе Капан. Старшая дочь Манвела студентка Юридического факультета Ереванского Государственного Университета . Жена Манвела домахозяйка и занимается воспитанием дочек и домашним хозяйством. Манвел является единственным кормилец в доме. 
Манвел окончил окончил Капанский строительный техникум,  по специальности маляр. Более 19 лет занимается ремонтом квартир в Капане и в ближайших городах Сюникской области. Содержать большую семью одному очень тяжело но Манвел справляется с этим достойно. 
У него много заказов от частных лиц  и организаций. Во время крупных заказов манвелу помогает двоюродный брат. 
Манвел делает все, чтобы  мечта детей сбылась и они получили хорошое  образование. 
Манвелу нужен кредит на сумму 500,000 Армянских драм для приобритения новых инструментов для ремонтных робот, так как все его инструменты уже устарели.
texts.en:
Manvel is 44 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two daughters in Kapan. Manvel's elder daughter is a law student at Yerevan State University. Manvel's wife is a homemaker and takes care of their daughters and the household. Manvel is the only breadwinner in the house. 

Manvel graduated from Kapan Construction School with a specialty in painting. For more than 19 years, he has been engaged in doing repairs in apartments in Kapan and in nearby Syunik districts. To take care of his large family is very difficult, but Manvel handles it with dignity. 

He has many orders from individuals and organizations. During large orders, Manvel is helped by his cousin.  

Manvel is doing everything in order to make his children's dreams come true and for them to get a good education. 

Manvel needs a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to purchase new tools for repair work, since all of his tools are outdated.

loans.use: to buy new instruments for repair work, as all his tools are outdated

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
This is Loida, 34, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Bernardo, a side car driver, and they have children. She manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Loida manages her side car transportation business. She has one side car, a bicycle cart that carries up to two passengers to their destination within the community. Her regular customers are laborers and employees in the community. She also has a variety store and a direct sales business. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan for maintenance on her side car unit and to buy grocery items for her variety store. Loida dreams that her business will grow and hopes to have a good life and future. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of their side car unit and buy grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Mr. Akram owns a children’s garments and toy shop in the area of Punjab, Pakistan. He belongs to a poor family. His monthly income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. He has requested a loan of PKR 100,000 from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan, he will purchase a variety of garments for his shop, including frocks, shirts and trousers. This will help him to offer more variety to his clients and to increase his net income and savings. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of children’s garments to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Marino

texts.en: Marino is a 41-year-old married man and the father of three children, ages 9, 7 and 2. Marino has been engaged in the motorcycle transport business for more than 10 years. He is also a fisherman. Marino is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance on his motorcycle and to buy new fishing nets. In the future, Marino hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance on the motorcycle he uses in his transport business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia, 48 years old, is married to a farmer, and they have been blessed with four children. She has been selling sausages in their village for almost five years. In this business, she earns a net income of PHP 15,000 a month. She would like to take out a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase ingredients for sausage-making. She is hoping that she will increase her income to permit her to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for sausage-making.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 32 years old and still single. She aims to become successful and financially stable in the future. Due to a lack of job opportunities, she runs a small variety store in the local community to generate income. She plans to improve the business and make it more profitable in order to generate sufficient income to help her parents in financing the education of her younger sister and to save for her future. To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy rice, canned goods, soft drinks, soaps, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, soft drinks, soaps, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Inacio

texts.es:
Inacio, tiene 30 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Inacio se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, específicamente  al cultivo del café. Este ha sido su fuente de ingreso con los cuales a podido mantener a sus hijos. La cosecha que saca la vende en el mercado local a un precio rentable, aunque hay competencia siempre el precio se mantiene.
Esta solicitando su cuarto préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para invertir en compra de fertilizante para el mantenimiento de la finca. Deseando obtener mejor calidad de producto y vender a mejor precio.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Inacio is 30 years old, married, has three children, and lives in the village of Taulabe, Comayagua.

Inacio has worked in agriculture for 10 years, specifically in the cultivation of coffee. This has been his source of income with which he has been able to care for his children. He takes the harvest to sell at a profitable price in the local market, and although there is competition, the price holds steady.

He is requesting his fourth loan of 15,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizer for maintaining the plantation. He wants to have a better quality product and sell it at a better price.

His goal is to continue working to be able to improve his home.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer for maintaining the plantation.

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es:
Ana, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, para las mejoras en el negocio, además considera haber tenido un buen desempeño con el préstamo anterior, ella comprara materiales de construcción para finalizar la construcción de un muro en su vivienda, tambien comprara maíz por mayor cantidad y leña.
Ella manifiesta, haber tenido un crecimiento en sus ventas, ya que conto con lo necesario para mejorar la producción de tortillas, en su familia ha cambiado las condiciones porque ha tenido mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to seek a new loan in order to make improvements to her business.  She believes that her previous loan made a positive impact. She reports that their has been an increase in her sales of tortillas, since she had the necessary materials to increase her production. 

She will buy construction materials so she can finish building a wall around her home.  She will also buy corn in large quantities and firewood.   Her family conditions have improved because she has had higher income.

loans.use: to buy construction materials so she can finish building a wall.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura, tiene 26 años, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, con quienes vive en su casa propia . Laura se dedica hace mas de un año al alquilar de su mototaxi, el cual adquirio a un precio muy comodo , actualmente sus ingresos diarios se mantienen estables, es por ello que desea comprar otro mototaxi pero esta vez uno nuevo para que el chofer que lo alquile pueda trabajar sin ninguna incomodidad. Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza ya que no requiere ningún tipo de esfuerzo y al mismo tiempo se puede ocupar de su familia sin ningun inconveniente, su gran deseo ahora es refaccionar su actual herramienta de trabajo y también comprar un mototaxi nuevo paracomplementar así su principal fuente de ingresos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles y agradece la oportunidad y la ayuda que le brindan las personas para acceder a este financiamiento y asi mejorar su fuente de ingresos.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y pagará la mano de obra del mecánico que reparará su mototaxi actual.
texts.en:
Laura is 26 years old, married, and has two young children with whom she lives in her own home.  Laura has been renting out a motorcycle taxi, which she acquired for a very good price, for more than one year.  Her daily income is currently stable and she would like to buy another, new motorcycle taxi so that the driver that rents it out can work without problems.  Laura really enjoys her work because it doesn't require any effort at all and allows her to take care of her family without difficulties.  Her biggest goal is to refurbish her current work tool and to buy a new motorcycle taxi so that she can complement her main source of income.

On this occasion, Laura is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles.  She is grateful for the opportunity and help that people are giving her to access this loan so that she can improve her source of income.  She will invest the amount that she has requested in buying tires and paying a mechanic to repair her current motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay a mechanic

loans.name: Norayr

texts.ru:
Норайр  родился в 1964г. в городе Капан  Сюникской области. У Норайра высшее образование , он окончил Ереванский Политехнический институт, по специальности инженер механик. Норайр живет с женой и двумя дочерьми в их родном городе Капан. 
В данный момент Норайр работает в  муниципалитете Капана. Но, как признался Норайр с его зарплатой очень трудно достойно содержать его большую семью и по этому он решил заниматся бизнесом. 
У Норайра есть собственное помещение в Капане, где он организовывает различные бизнес семинары и часто сдает в аренду для подобных мероприятий. Он считает что Капан нуждается в таких помещениях так как это развивающийся город с огромными потенциалами и он уверен, что в его конференц зале скоро будут проходить важные семинары и совещания , которые будут направлены на развития Капана и Сюникской области. 
Норайру нужен кредит на сумму 1,000,000 Армянских драм для завершения ремонтных работ в его конференц зале.
texts.en:
Norayr was born in 1964 in Kapan, Syunik district. Norayr has a higher education; he graduated from Yerevan Political Institute with a major in mechanical engineering. Norayr lives with his wife and two daughters in their hometown Kapan. 

At the moment, Norayr works in the Kapan Municipality. However as Norayr admitted, with his salary it is very difficult to adequately support his large family and therefore he decided to engage in business. 

Norayr has his own premises in Kapan, where he organizes a variety of business seminars and often rents the place for such events. He considers that Kapan needs these kinds of premises as this is a growing city with a huge potential, and he is certain that his conference room will soon host major seminar and workshops, which will focus on the development of Kapan and the Syunk district. 

Norayr needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian dram to complete the repair work on his conference room.

loans.use: to repair his conference room for renting

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Анвар  отец  4 детей и любящий муж.  Он разводит дома скот.   У него большой дом и хозяйство.  Cемья Анвара поддерживает его в развитии его хозяйства. Они помогают выращивать овощи, различные фрукты и разводить скот. Каждые 3 месяца Анвар  выводит  овец на рынок для продажи и сразу же покупает молодых овец. Таким образом он развивает свой бизнес.   Анвар кроме откорма скота вывозит абрикос за пределы страны. В его отсутствии его дети и жена ухаживают за скотом. 
Анвар  запрашивает кредит для того, чтобы купить несколько голов скота.
texts.en:
Anvar is the father of four children and a loving husband. He cares for livestock at his home. He has a big home and farm. Anvar's family supports him in the development of the farm. They help to grow vegetables, different fruits, and tending livestock. 

Every three months, Anvar displays sheet on the market for sale and immediately buys young sheep. In this way, he develops his business. Besides fattening livestock, Anvar exports apricots from the country. In his absence, his children and wife look after the cattle. 

Anvar is asking for a loan to buy a few head of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gasolo

texts.en: Gasolo is a 43-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Gasolo has requested a loan to buy weed spray, weed killers, bush knives, fertilizers, a wheelbarrow and baby taros. She joined SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Gasolo hopes to improve her business to help her family and pay for her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy plants, gardening equipment, weed killer and fertilizer.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 54 years old and married with five children.

Carmelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks such as soap, canned goods, milk and sugar.

Carmelita has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Carmelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks such as soap, canned goods, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 45 years old, married and has six children. She is operating a small store to gain income of PHP 5,000 each month. She uses it to pay school fees and revolving capital in the business too. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, noodles and soap to sell. This will help increase sales capacity and income as well. 

In the future, Belinda hopes to keep selling good products and services to all her customers and gain good profits for financial security.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, noodles and soap to sell

loans.name: Edin Neptali

texts.es:
Edin tiene 26 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Edin es agricultor, específicamente se dedica hace 3 años al cultivo de café, ya que el lugar donde el vive es acto para estos cultivos. Manifiesta que la cosecha que saca la vende en el mercado local  a un precio rentable. Con este negocio ha podido solventar  todos los gastos del hogar.
En la actualidad solicito un préstamo de 22,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante para el mantenimiento del cultivo. Esta inversión le a mantener sus cultivos en buen estado, además venderá producto de primera calidad.
Su meta es seguir trabajando fuerte para tener los suficientes ingresos para la manutención de su familia.
texts.en:
Edin is 26 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the village of Taulabe, Comayagua.

Edin is a farmer; specifically, he has grown coffee for the past three years because the place where he lives is good for these crops. He takes the harvest that he gets to sell in the local market for a profitable price. With this business, he has been able to cover all of his household expenses.

He is now requesting a loan of 22,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizer to maintain the crops. This investment will help him keep his crops in good health as well as sell a top quality product.

His goal is to continue working hard to have enough income to provide for his family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer to maintain his coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлуба женщина возрасте 35 лет. Она замужем и имеет  троих  прекрасных детей.  Недавно ее муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию  на заработки и  для покупки билета Матлюба  вынуждена была продать скот. Муж обещал присылать деньги только тогда, когда устроится на работу. Но пока ее муж не присылает денежных средств,  поэтому Матлюба вынуждена сама зарабатывать на жизнь себе и своим детям. 
 У нее дома есть несколько  голов скота,  их сейчас нельзя продавать так как они еще пока недостаточно упитанны.  Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит для покупки скота. Через пару недель она сможет продать своих откормленных  скотов и на полученную прибыль улучшить  свою жизнь а также  развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Matluba is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has three beautiful children. Recently, her husband left for Russia to earn money and in order to buy a ticket Matluba had to sell cattle. Her husband promised to send money as soon as he found a job. But while her husband is not sending money, Matluba on her own needs to earn a living for herself and her children. 

Her household has a few head of cattle. They can not be sold for now because they are not sufficiently fattened. Therefore, she turned to Arvand to get a loan for the purchase of cattle. In a few weeks, she will be able to sell her fattened cattle and, with the profits, to improve her life and to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Alfayo

texts.en:
Alfayo is a 33-year-old man from Kaimosi in Kakamega County which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married and supports three people in his family. His wife's name is Beatricia and they have been blessed with one child who is three years old.

Alfayo operates a small hotel in Kaimosi; he has been doing this business for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

He is taking his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more equipment for his hotel such as plastic seats and tables for his customers. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. He has a dream of expanding his business and taking good care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for his hotel such as plastic seats and tables for his customers.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en: Donna is a 38-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has had a small business, a retail shop, for three years. Donna needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, rice, snacks, chicken legs, mutton flaps, herrings, salt, snacks and soft drinks. She will use her profits to improve her business and to help her family and pay for her kids' education. Donna joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, snacks, chicken legs, salt, flour, cooking oil and soft drinks for her general store.

loans.name: Herminda

texts.en:
Herminda is 50 years old, married and has three children. To acquire income for the family, she buys and sells rice, vegetables and fish. She has been in her business for over five years now and earns about PHP 6,000 each month. She also raises hogs for future sale. 

She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 8,000 to buy sacks of rice, vegetables and fish to sell. This will help improve sales for the development of her business. Additional revenue generated will be used for education purposes and hogs' sustenance.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, vegetables and fish to sell

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
El joven Juan Alberto es originario de esta localidad, y aunque solo estudio hasta secundaria por cuestiones economicas es una persona muy emprendedora, trabajadora y amable, desde muy joven trabajo para una industria maquiladora de la localidad donde logró conseguir crédito para su vivienda. Aunque es una persona soltera tiene la responsabilidad de sus padres que son personas mayores y no cuentan con pensión.

El joven Juan Alberto pensaba hace cinco años en emprender su propio negocio y así lo hizo en aquel tiempo, ha ampliado su casa gracias al apoyo obtenido atraves de KIVA, ya que con los créditos anteriores que se le han brindado han sido para construirla y ampliarla.
Ahora quiere comprar material para instalar piso y puerta, haciendo cambiar el aspecto de su hogar, siempre tratando de que luzca más bonito y agradable para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto is a Young man from this region. Even though he only completed up to junior high due to economic reasons, he is an entrepreneur, a good worker and a kind person. Starting at a very young age, he worked in the manufacturing industry of the region, where he attained credit to buy his own house. Even though he is a single man, he takes care of his parents who are pension less and retired.
Five years ago Juan Alberto thought of starting his own business which at the time he did. He has expanded his home thanks to the support he has received through KIVA, because the past loans he has received had been to construct and to expand his home.
Now, he wants to purchase material to install the floor and a door, making his home aspects seem more beautiful and pleasant for his family.

loans.use: Purchase materials for floor installation.

loans.name: Hushnazar

texts.ru:
Хушназар обратился в Арванд за кредитом чтобы приобрести скот.  Он женат и имеет детей. Они живут в сельской местности.  Хушназар занимается откормом скота.  Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже много лет.  Также Хушназар выращивает абрикосы, летом сушит их и зимой продает сушеные абрикосы.  Выращивание абрикосов является сезонным бизнесом но откормом скота Хушназар занимается круглый год, и этот бизнес дает ему хороший доход.  Многие его друзья и знакомые уехали в РТ на заработки но Хушназар не хочет оставлять свою семью и старается прожить здесь на родине.  
На полученный кредит Хушназар планирует купить скот и увеличить поголовье своего скота.  Он надеется,что расширив свой бизнес сможет осуществить свою давнею мечту и купить машину для перевозки овец.
texts.en:
Hushnazar turned to Arvand for a loan to purchase livestock. He is married with children. They live in a rural area. Hushnazar is engaged in fattening cattle. He has been involved in this type of activity for many years. Hushnazar also grows apricots, dries them in the summer, and in the winter sells the dried fruits. Growing apricots is a seasonal business, but Hushnazar engages in fattening livestock all year round, and this business gives him a good income. 

Many of his friends and acquaintances went to the Russian Federation for work, but Hushnazar did not want to leave his family and is trying to make a living here in the homeland. 

Hushnazar plans to use the loan to buy cattle to increase the number of his livestock. He hopes that by expanding his business he can realize his dream and buy a vehicle for transporting sheep.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Diamantino

texts.pt:
Natural de xai-xai casado maritalmente, pai de 4 filhos dois quais um na idade escolar, outro ainda menor e dois envolvidos em projectos de geração de rendimentos. É residente em Boane
É comerciante e possui um negócio próprio e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar sêmea e farelo para revenda.
Futuramente almeja ampliar seu negócio e adquiri uma viatura para o escoamento da sua mercadoria
O seu maior desafio é conseguir um financiamento que possa responder as necessidades da procura.
texts.en:
Diamantino comes from Xai-Xai. He's married and has four children. One of his children is school-aged, another one is under school age and two of them are involved in income-generation projects. He lives in Boane.
He's in retail and runs his own business. He intends to use the current loan to purchase bran and middlings for re-selling.
His future goal is to expand his business and acquire a vehicle for carrying his merchandise.
His biggest challenge is obtaining a loan that allows him to meet the demand as needed.

loans.use: to purchase bran and middlings for re-selling.

loans.name: Ma. Chrisenta

texts.en:
Ma. Chrisenta got married three years ago. She is now 22 years old and has one child. To supplement her spouse's income, she opened a small store and sells grocery items to the people in her village. She usually earns about PHP 6,000 each month, which is used for meals, bills at home and revolving capital in the business. She aspires to make additional income and is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy soap, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs and noodles to sell. It will help maintain good sales.

Ma Chrisenta hopes to improve her family's living conditions by developing her business and continuing to offer good products and services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs and noodles to sell

loans.name: Tiute

texts.en: Tiute is 36 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flours, oil, a gas oven, sugar, a large tin bowl and baking soda. In the future, Tiute hopes to improve her business to help her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flours, sugar, cooking oil, baking soda and a large cooking pot.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 19-year-old woman from Garcia, Bohol. She engages in a fishing business. She has been in this business for three years now, together with her family. This is the source of her income.
Marissa is requesting a loan to buy a fish net, lead weights, floaters and hooks. These materials will be very helpful in catching fish. The loan will provide what Marissa needs for her business. In the future, Marissa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, lead weights, floaters and hooks.

loans.name: Irela Gaudalupe

texts.es:
Irela, 47 años de edad,  originaria de León, casada, madre de 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería de la que es propietaria hace más de 2 años. Desde muy joven inicio en el ámbito del comercio, con capital propio, vendiendo hielo y gaseosa, luego con las ganancias que le genero este negocio  pudo emprender su propio negocio de pulpería, recibe el apoyo de su hijo quien le ayuda. 
Irela esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, pollo, gaseosa, queso, pinturas de uñas y una vitrina. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar todos los productos que aun no tiene en inventario, con el objetivo de ir incrementando las ventas para obtener mejores ganancias, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder comprar un frízer y a la misma vez   mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su negocio, para dar una mejor presentación y de esta manera atraer mas clientes, unas de sus metas próximas  es poder cancelar el crédito, para luego volver a solicitar otro, para seguir invirtiendo mas en su pulpería hasta convertirla en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
47-year-old Irela is from León. She is married and has three adult children. She works as a trader and she has been the owner of a grocery store for more than 2 years. 

She started in the field of commerce at a very young age with her own capital selling ice and soda water. Later on with the profits the business generated for her, she was able to launch her own grocery business with the support of her son who helps her.

Irela needs finance to buy rice, sugar, oil, chicken, soda water, cheese, nail polish and a display cabinet. She believes this loan will help her to buy all the products that she doesn't yet have in stock, with the objective of increasing sales to earn better profits. 

Among her future plans is to buy a freezer and at the same time improve the infrastructure of the premises where she has her business to give better presentation and in this way attract more customers. One of her next goals is to repay the loan, and to later apply for another one in order to keep investing in her grocery store until she turns it into a corner shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, chicken, soda water, cheese, nail polish and a display cabinet.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filha que frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É militar e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, ferro, areia, cimento, blocos e outros) para construir um murro de vedação em sua casa.
No futuro pretende continuar com os seus estudos de licenciamento em agronomia, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar ainda mais e economizar para poder conseguir realizar os seus desejos.
texts.en:
Paulino is married and has a daughter who attends school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a serviceman. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (rocks, iron, sand, cement, bricks, etc.) in order to build a surrounding wall around his house.
In the future he plans to keep on studying to become a licensed agronomist. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is working even harder and saving money in order to accomplish his goals.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (rocks, iron, sand, cement, bricks, etc.) in order to build a surrounding wall around his house.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 32 years of age and a single mother to two children aged 13 and eight years old. She has a hotel business in Tala town and has run it for the last five years. This will be her first loan and she plans to use the amount to buy more stocks of food stuff for use in her hotel business. These include cooking oil, baking flour, maize flour, rice, sugar and cereals such as beans and maize. She also plans to buy more utensils. She plans to use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business by opening more hotels in the area, offering catering services as well as opening a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs such as cooking oil, baking flour, maize flour, rice, sugar and cereals for use in her hotel.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites raises hogs and sells them once they reach their desired weight. She is 46 years old, married and has five children. She has been raising hogs for over two years now and earns approximately PHP 3,000 for each hog. She wants to grow healthier hogs that is why she is now asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and vaccines for the hogs.
 
Someday, she hopes to have a profitable business to help lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Damiana's Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KISWARAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Damiana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tucumanas, tienda de barrio, panadería, venta de queso, venta de cerveza, tejido de chompas, venta de sillas,  venta de juguetes, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Damiana es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de panadería; da a conocer que este negocio lo heredó de sus padres hace varios años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las ferias las empresas distribuidoras, ciudad de La Paz, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "KISWARAS" will begin its second loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana regional office. This group is composed of ten members and is led by a board of directors with Damiana serving as the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank undertake are varied; among others there are the following: tucumana sales, neighborhood grocery store, bakery, cheese sales, alcohol sales, knitting sweaters, chair sales, toy sales, bookstore. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit micro-business owners such as the member Damiana. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 1 year, joining by an invitation from a consultant of the institution who went to visit her at her home. Currently, she has a bakery business; she says that she inherited this business from her parents several years ago. 

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital (buying flour) that she will acquire from fairs and distributors in the city of La Paz, and after preparation, she will sell it at her place of business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain home as best as possible since she is single and has a daughter. 
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings and the training sessions revolving around health and credit.

loans.use: to buy flour.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera is 59 years old. She lives in the Gori District with her husband, who has a retirement pension. Her husband also has a counter at local market where he sells different kinds of spices. Venera has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Venera has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program includes provisions for business start-up and start again credits with soft repayment conditions for the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products. They are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Venera plans to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then resell with a price markup among her villagers. This will increase the income of her family. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a 25 year old single woman with no children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Susana needs a loan to buy pancake ingredients. She plans to use her profits to improve the financial situation of her family. Susana has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, and baking powder.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 37 years old and a very industrious mother and wife. She has a business selling snacks in the village that provides her three children’s educational needs. The income she generates from her business is carefully utilized in order to save money. Now, to develop more income, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP to buy snack foods, bananas, soft drinks, sugar and milk. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, bananas, soft drinks, sugar and milk

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of bed sheets and pillowcases. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. This has been her business for fifteen years. She and her husband work hand in hand to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of bed sheets and pillowcases. In addition to that, she also sells towels and blankets. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennifer dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for bed sheets, towels, blankets and pillowcases for her business.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Sandra es cliente kiva ella se siente muy agradecida por su primer préstamo  ya que le fue de gran ayuda porque pudo invertir mas en su negocio comprando mas pan como picos, pudines, pasteles, empanadas, donas,   ya que este productos es muy demandados por su clientela, ella dice que quiere ofrecer otra variedad de pan a sus cliente con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias, es por eso que hoy en día ella esta solicitando su segundo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de pan de  milanesa,  pan de especies y polvorones, dentro de sus planes futuro es poder cancelar el crédito, para luego volver a solicitar otro.
texts.en:
Sandra is a Kiva customer. She is very grateful for her first loan. It was a great help because she was able to invest more in her business buying more bread like snacks, puddings, cakes, empanadas (bread-dough with filling), and doughnuts, as these products are in high demand from her customers. 

She says that she wants to offer other varieties of bread to her customers with the intention to increase her sales and earn more profit. It's for this reason that she is currently applying for a loan. It's her second loan so she can keep on investing by buying milanesa (a type of breaded cutlet) bread, spiced gingerbread and polvorones (a type of thick cookie like shortbread). Her future plans include being able to pay back her loan so that later she can apply again for another one.

loans.use: to buy milanesa (a type of breaded cutlet) bread, spiced gingerbread, and polvorones (a type of thick cookie like shortbread)

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a tricycle driver who lives in Amulung in the Philippines. He is 40 years old, married and has two children. He provides motorcycle transport services for their village and is asking for additional capital for maintenance. He is requesting P7,000 to buy gasoline and provide maintenance for his tricycle. He hopes to ensure travel safety for all his passengers and also earn good profits to educate his children. He will be very happy to see them working as professionals in their chosen careers someday.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and maintain his cycle

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
Doña Maria tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos en una aldea de Peña Blanca, Cortes.
Doña Maria vende mercadería, hace varios años lo inicio con la necesidad de no tener la ayuda del padre de sus hijos. Ella ofrece cosméticos, ropa, sandalias y también venta de plásticos, las ventas las hace de manera ambulante. Manifiesta que le va bien ya que  ha podido solventar los gastos del hogar.
Este es su tercer  préstamo de 6,000.00 lempiras para compra de mercadería que le hace falta como sandalias, ropa, sandalias etc. Para ofrecer variedad de producto a los clientes y tener una mayor demanda.
Su meta es seguir trabajando  con financiamientos para que su negocio de mantenga estable y comprar otros productos que tengan demanda.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old. She is a single mother with three children. She lives with them in a small village in Peña Blanca, in Cortes.

Maria sells merchandise. She started doing this several years ago out of need because she did not have help from the father of her children. She offers cosmetics, clothes, and sandals, in addition to plastic products. She sells them on the street. She says it is going well and that she has been able to pay for all the household expenses.

This is her third loan of 6,000 lempiras, with which she will buy merchandise, such as clothing and sandals, so she can offer a greater variety to her customers and have greater demand. Her goal is to continue working with financing so that her business will remain stable and so she can buy other products in demand.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her business, such as as cosmetics, clothing, and plastic.

loans.name: Dolibe

texts.es: Dolibe, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, está casada y tiene 3 hijos que ya son adultos, vive en su casa propia junto a toda su familia además de sus nietos, todos trabajan día a día para llevar una vida tranquila y sin carencias.El trabajo de Dolibe consiste en la venta de abarrotes  de primera necesidad, entre los que se encuentran; arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras y mas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa en donde atiende todos los días. Lleva trabajando 5 años en este rubro. Al inicio tuvo la ayuda de su esposo pero ahora se dedica ella misma a tiempo completo a atender a su clientela. Complementa su bodega con la venta ocasional de diferentes prendas de vestir, zapatos y cosméticos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir las principales funciones de su hogar, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tienen clientes debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece y porque además en la única bodega en su zona, espera poder seguir surgiendo y hacer crecer su negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2300 soles y agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito financiero que le brinda la seguridad de continuar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará mercadería para la venta en su bodega conformada por golosinas, arroz, azúcar, panes, huevos, leche, aceites, verduras, productos de lavandería y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Dolibe, 60, is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She's married and has three adult children.  She lives in her own house with her whole family as well as her grandchildren.  They all work every day to have a peaceful life without needs.

Dolibe's job is selling grocery necessities, including rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, vegetables, and more.  Her business is in her house, where she waits on customers every day.  She has worked in this field for five years.

In the beginning she had the help of her husband, but now she herself works full-time tending to her customers.  She supplements her store with occasional sales of various garments, shoes, and cosmetics.

What she likes about her job is that she has time to carry out her main household tasks.  Fortunately it's going very well for her.  She always has customers because of the variety of products she sells; also, it's the only grocery store in her area.  She hopes to be able to continue developing and make her business grow.

Currently she's requesting 2300 soles [PEN].  She's grateful to those who are giving her the opportunity of getting this loan, which will give her the security to continue with her job.  She also pledges to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount she'll buy merchandise to sell in her store: sweets, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, vegetables, laundry products, and soda.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and other products

loans.name: Tinah

texts.en:
"Tinah is 31 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married  and has two children. For the past three years, Tinah has been working hard to manage her agrochemical shop, which trades in fertilizers and pesitcides . 

To help expand her business, Tinah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase spray pumps, and will help Tinah to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Tinah hopes that in the future she will be able to get profits from the business . 

Tinah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tinah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more agro-chemicals for resale.

loans.name: Meretaeutu

texts.en: Meretaeutu is 42 years old and married.  She has five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling curry and rice and snack food in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of rice, curry powder, chickens, flour, onions and snacks. In the future, Meretaeutu hopes to improve her business to help her kids' educations and her family matters. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rice, curry powder, flour, onions, cooking oil, chicken legs,.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, a 36-year-old hardworking woman, has one child. Her husband works as a farmer. To help support the family, Marilyn offers the services of pedicure and manicure to individuals. She has applied for the loan of PHP 8,000 to buy a new nipper, pusher, nail polish and cuticle remover to render better service and increase income. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved.

loans.use: to buy a new nipper, pusher, nail polish and cuticle remover

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en: Jannet is a 34-year-old woman from the Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase an additional 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will sell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Jannet started selling lights in February 2012, and she has sold 90 lights to date, providing clean energy to 450 people. She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for her and her husband.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to sell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Malo

texts.en: Malo is a 66-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas, taro, yams, and cocoa to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Malo has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, weed spray, weed killers, spades, a wheel barrow, a mist blower, and banana chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Malo hopes to improve her business to help her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, shovels, gloves, and weed killer

loans.name: Nelson Rafael

texts.es: Nelson de 42 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijas en las edades de 6 y 16 años; Nelson se dedica  a la venta de almuerzos entre pobladores vecinos, mediante créditos que ofrece a corto plazo, sus principales clientes son empleados de empresas cercanas que semanalmente le pagan los almuerzos consumidos a diario. Entre su lista de menú está elaborada base de carnes y pescados, los cuales son los alimentos que mas consumen sus compradores. En la actualidad Nelson ha aplicado a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos como arroz, cárnicos y víveres en general. Su clientela crece todos los días un poco más y muchas veces   se van de su negocio, sin haber logrado obtener su almuerzo.   Su meta es ampliar su cobertura de servicios y llevar sus productos a muchas más empresas del sector, con su  credikiva esto y mucho mas logrará, en función de su bienestar y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson is 42 years old and lives in the municipality of Malambo with his spouse and their two daughters in the ages of 6 and 16 years.

Nelson makes a living selling lunches among neighboring settlers through short term credits that her offers. His main customers are employees of nearby businesses that pay weekly the lunches they consumed daily. The menu is beef and fish based, which are the favorite food of his customers. 

Today Nelson has applied to a Credikiva, this is the first loan with the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy ingredients such as rice, meat and others. 

His clientele grows every day and many times they have to leave without eating. His goal is to expand his service coverage and take his products to more companies in the area, with the loan from Credikiva, this and much more can be achieved, which will improve the welfare of him and his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat and others.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP to buy more merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lorna dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a good life with her family.  She meets every week with her co-fellowship members where she can share stories of her life and business and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 51 years old and married. He supports his five children, who are between 20 and five years old. He is a contractor and has been in this line of work for six years. He gets a monthly income of KES 40,000.

He is borrowing a second loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to buy modern equipment like a gauging trowel, plumb line, etc. and to pay school fees for his children who are in secondary school. 

The profits he earns will be used to pay the loan. His dream is to ensure that his children get the best education.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 31 years old, married, and blessed with two children. To help her family, she built up her own business. She has a piggery business that was built at the back of their house.  Now, she is requesting PHP 7,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs’ growth. She hopes that through this loan, she will be able to increase her sales because she wishes to save for the family's development .

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina works hard to support her family. Delfina is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Delfina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Delfina has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Delfina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Peivi

texts.en: Peivi is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a small business selling cocoa in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Peivi has requested a loan to buy cocoa beans and other items for her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to funds. With her earnings, Peivi will use her business profits to support her family.

loans.use: To buy cocoa beans and plastic cups

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 21-year-old woman from Garcia, Bohol. She has been working in a fishing business for 4 years now. This is the source of her income, as well as her family's.

Nancy is requesting a loan to buy a machine, plywood, and paint. This will help her to catch fish easier. The paint will be used to make her boat look good. By the help of this loan, she will be able to comply with what she needs for the productivity of her business.

In the future, Nancy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a machine, plywood, and paint

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 41 years old and a mother of eight children. To provide for their needs, she works in a hog-fattening business. She does not want her children to encounter difficulties. So as early as now, Editha and her husband are already saving for their children's future. She is applying for a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase feed and vitamins. She wants to improve her business with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and a widow with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for 9 years and also earns additional income from selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama is 62 years old and married with 8 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, a large tin bowl, a new gas oven, oil, and baking powder. In the future, Mama hopes to improve her business to help her children's education and her family's living standards. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, a large tin bowl, cooking oil, and baking powder

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.ru:
Умринисо получает кредит для развития своего бизнеса. Она пенсионерка и работы для ее возраста найти очень трудно. Дети все выросли и имеют свои семьи которым тоже нужна помощь, поэтому Умринисо хочет сама найти пути выживания и помочь своим детям.  Она содержит дома несколько овец .  У нее раньше были коровы но  так как Умринисо в возрасте ей приходилась трудно выращивать крупно рогатый скот. Она решила откармливать овец. Также Умринисо продает шерсть овец и имеет от этого небольшой доход.  
Умринисо копит денежные средства на свадьбу внука. Хочет купить внуку приданное.  Но пока ей  не хватает денег поэтому она старается развивать бизнес по откорму овец.
На запрашиваемый  кредит Умринисо хочет купить несколько овец и надеется,что ее планы осуществятся.
texts.en:
Umriniso is receiving a loan to expand her business.  She is a pensioner and it is very difficult to find a job at her age.  The children are all grown and have their own families who also need help, this is why Umriniso would herself like to find a way to survive and to help her children.  She keeps several sheep in her home.  Previously she had cows, but because Umriniso is elderly it was hard for her to raise large horned livestock.  She decided to raise sheep.  Umriniso also sells wool from the sheep and earns a small income from this.

Umriniso is saving money for her grandson's wedding.  She would like to buy a dowry for her grandson.  But for now she does not have enough money because she is trying to grow her sheep business. 

Umriniso would like to use the loan to buy several sheep and hopes that her plans are realized.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ailima

texts.en:
Ailima is a 45 year old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro root and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Ailima has requested a loan to buy weed killer, weed sprayer and other equipment. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Ailima hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy weed killer and weed sprayer.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aurora Esther

texts.es: Aurora  de 62 años de edad, es una mujer viuda que  vive en el municipio de Soledad, una población  muy cercana a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí  tiene una clínica de ropas donde repara toda clase de vestidos y también confecciona en la línea femenina, mediante ventas a crédito y de contado, a  una clientela que construyó antes de que fuera totalmente independiente, cuando fue  operaria en una gran confección en la ciudad de Barranquilla.
